Description: Iraq invades Kuwait leading to supply shock and price surge.
Economic turmoil in Asia reduces global oil demand.
Terrorist attacks in the US lead to market uncertainty and demand concerns.
US-led invasion of Iraq impacts a major oil-producing nation.
Significant disruption to Gulf of Mexico oil production and refining.
Oil prices reach record highs before crashing due to global recession.
Arab Spring unrest in Libya leads to supply disruptions.
Excess supply and OPEC's refusal to cut leads to price collapse.
Sanctions relief leads to return of Iranian oil to global markets.
First major agreement including non-OPEC members to stabilize prices.
Disagreement over cuts leads to temporary production surge and price drop.
Global lockdowns lead to unprecedented collapse in oil demand.
Invasion of Ukraine leads to sanctions and supply security concerns.
